intro: Urostigma glabellum, commonly known as the smooth bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately divided, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Urostigma glabellum is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
